('Jinx', '烏鴉嘴'): Every time she walks in, the team's luck flips because she's a total Jinx.
她一進來，團隊的運氣就翻了，真是個十足的烏鴉嘴。
I hate being a Jinx, I mention plans and they instantly fall apart.
我討厭自己是個烏鴉嘴，只要我一說計畫，它們就立刻全都泡湯。
Calling someone a Jinx after one mistake just makes everyone nervous and awkward.
把別人說成烏鴉嘴只是讓大家緊張又尷尬。
We shouldn't say she is a Jinx before the project's even had a chance.
在專案還沒開始前就說她是烏鴉嘴，太不應該了。
My brother jokingly calls me a Jinx whenever I mention future travel plans.
每次我提到未來旅行計劃，我哥哥就笑著叫我烏鴉嘴。
('Out of pocket', '自費'): I paid the whole procedure out of pocket since insurance didn't cover it.
因為保險不理賠，我只好自費負擔整個療程。
She decided to travel abroad out of pocket for the special research opportunity.
她決定自費出國，參加那個特別的研究機會。
If you want premium seating, you'll have to pay out of pocket, I'm afraid.
如果你想要尊榮座位，我恐怕你得自費支付。
('flab', '贅肉'): Those late-night snacks really added flab to my waistline and hips.
那些深夜吃的零食真的讓我的腰和臀部多了些贅肉。
She blamed the pregnancy for the stubborn flab she still couldn't lose.
她把懷孕當藉口，怪自己仍然減不掉的贅肉。
I've been doing crunches every morning to try to lose the stubborn flab around my waist.
我每天早上都在做仰臥起坐，想把腰部那頑固的贅肉減掉。
She joked that the holiday cookies left a little flab on her lower belly.
她開玩笑說節日的餅乾讓她下腹多了點贅肉。
You can hide flab under thicker clothes, but exercise still helps a lot.
你可以用厚一點的衣服遮住贅肉，但運動仍然很有幫助。
('Choke up', '哽咽'): She tried to smile but began to choke up during her speech.
她想要微笑，但在演講時開始哽咽了。
Don't choke up now; finish telling the story so we can laugh together.
現在別哽咽，把故事講完，這樣我們才能一起笑。
('Hold a seat', '佔位子'): If the line gets longer, I’ll hold a seat until you finish shopping.
如果隊伍變長，我會幫你佔位子，直到你逛完再回來。
Hey, can you hold a seat for me while I grab some coffee?
嘿，你可以幫我佔位子嗎？我要去拿杯咖啡。
If someone else asks, tell them I'll pay to hold a seat here.
如果有人問，就跟他們說我會付錢讓人在這裡幫我佔位子。
Don't worry, my friend will hold a seat near the stage for us.
別擔心，我朋友會在舞台旁幫我們佔位子。
('hypocrite', '偽君子'): Don't act surprised when people call you a hypocrite for changing your stance.
別假裝驚訝，當大家因你改變立場而叫你偽君子時。
He pretends to care about the environment but he's a hypocrite through and through.
他假裝很關心環境，但他簡直就是個十足的偽君子。
If you're constantly criticizing others while doing the same, you are a hypocrite.
如果你老是在批評別人但自己也做同樣的事，那你就是個偽君子。
('Give someone the eye', '拋媚眼'): At the party, she kept trying to give him the eye across the room.
在派對上，她一直試圖在房間那頭向他拋媚眼。
Don't pretend you didn't notice her give the waiter the eye last night.
別裝作沒發現她昨晚對那位服務生拋媚眼。
He tried to give his boss the eye, but it only made things awkward.
他試圖對老闆拋媚眼，但只讓場面變得尷尬。
('taken', '死會'): Don't even try flirting with him; he's taken and committed to someone else.
別想去調情他，他已經死會了，對別人很認真且有承諾。
We should respect boundaries, since my friend is taken and not available.
我們應該尊重界線，我朋友已經死會了，不適合追求。
('Be left out', '被冷落'): Sometimes I seem to be left out even when people invite me, which hurts.
即使別人邀請我，我有時也覺得被冷落，這讓我很受傷。
If you ignore my messages, I'll begin to be left out and get upset.
如果你忽視我的訊息，我會開始被冷落並且感到難過。
('Keep an eye on', '顧個東西的「顧」'): Please keep an eye on the kids at the pool for the next hour.
請在接下來一小時幫我顧一下泳池邊的孩子們。
I'll keep an eye on the oven so nothing burns while you're gone.
我會顧著烤箱，確保食物不會燒焦，你出門可以放心。
(\"Hit one's funny bone\", '戳中笑點'): That goofy dance in the video hits the audience's funny bone every single time.
影片裡那個傻氣的舞蹈每次都戳中觀眾的笑點。
Tell another ridiculous joke; it might hit his funny bone and lighten the mood.
再講個荒謬的笑話吧，說不定會戳中他的笑點，讓氣氛變輕鬆。
('Go steady', '穩交'): I told my friends I'm ready to go steady with someone special now.
我跟朋友說我現在準備好要跟特別的人穩交了。
If you both like each other, why not go steady and see what happens?
如果你們互相有好感，為什麼不穩交看看會發生什麼事？
('get a blister', '起水泡'): Make sure to tape your heels before long runs, or you'll get a blister.
長跑前記得在腳跟貼膠布，否則會起水泡。
Don't walk barefoot on hot pavement, otherwise you'll probably get a blister.
不要在燙熱的路面赤腳走，否則很可能會起水泡。
('Stand someone up', '放鴿子'): If you stand someone up, don't be surprised when they stop trusting you.
如果你放鴿子，不要驚訝他們會不再信任你。
I hate it when friends stand someone up and never offer any real explanation.
我討厭朋友放鴿子，卻從不給出任何真正的解釋。
('on the same wavelength', '頻率很合'): After talking for an hour, I realized we were on the same wavelength creatively.
聊了一個小時後，我發現我們在創意上頻率很合。
It's rare to meet someone you're on the same wavelength with so quickly.
這麼快就遇到一個和你頻率很合的人很少見。
('Got cheated on', '被劈腿了'): She got cheated on and didn't tell anyone until months had passed, sadly.
她被劈腿了，但過了好幾個月才告訴別人，真可惜。
If you got cheated on, remember it's not your fault and seek support.
如果你被劈腿了，記得這不是你的錯，要尋求支持。
(\"Lose one's touch\", '退步'): I used to make perfect shots, but lately I feel I'm losing my touch.
我以前出手都很準，但最近覺得自己技術在退步。
Don't worry if you miss a few beats; you won't lose your touch forever.
如果你失誤幾次也別擔心；你不會永遠退步的。
('kept man', '小白臉'): He used to resent being a kept man, yet now he's comfortable and content.
他以前討厭當小白臉，但現在反而覺得舒服又滿足。
When friends visit, they tease him about being a kept man and laugh.
朋友來訪時都會嘲笑他是小白臉，然後大家一起笑鬧。
('jump the gun', '操之過急'): We don't want to jump the gun, so let's wait for official confirmation first.
我們別操之過急，所以先等官方確認再說。
She almost jumped the gun by announcing the merger, but paused for details.
她差點操之過急就宣佈合併，但還是暫停等細節。
('slowpoke', '慢郎中'): I called him three times, but that slowpoke still hasn't shown up.
我打了他三通電話，但那個慢郎中還沒出現。
Don't be a slowpoke, hurry up and grab your shoes before we leave.
別當慢郎中了，快點拿鞋，我們要出門了。
My brother's such a slowpoke that he missed the beginning of the movie.
我哥哥真是個慢郎中，結果錯過了電影的開始。
If you act like a slowpoke, we'll finish the project way past the deadline.
如果你像個慢郎中，我們會在最後期限之後才完成專案。
('vicious cycle', '惡性循環'): Late payments raise fees, worsen credit, and start a vicious cycle you can't escape.
延遲付款會增加費用、破壞信用，進而開始你無法擺脫的惡性循環。
Burnout lowers performance, which then increases stress and fuels a vicious cycle at work.
倦怠會降低表現，進而增加壓力，助長職場上的惡性循環。
('fair-weather friend', '酒肉朋友'): Don't trust him too much; he's probably a fair-weather friend who disappears.
別太相信他，他大概是個酒肉朋友，遇事就消失了。
After the promotion, most coworkers turned into fair-weather friends eager for favors.
升職後，大多數同事都變成了酒肉朋友，熱衷於向你索取好處。
('s', '慢郎中'): Stop acting like an s and pick up the pace, we have deadlines.
別再像個慢郎中一樣拖拖拉拉，快點，我們有截止期限。
If you're an s about plans, don't be surprised when they change.
如果你對計畫總是像個慢郎中一樣遲緩，變動時別感到驚訝。
('別當慢郎中。', \"Don't be a slowpoke.\"): If you're running late, don't be a slowpoke and move it, please.
如果你要遲到了，別當慢郎中，請快一點。
Stop dawdling; don't be a slowpoke or you'll miss the beginning.
別再磨蹭了，別當慢郎中，否則你會錯過開始。
('烏鴉嘴',): Calling him unlucky will only jinx his chances of getting the job, honestly.
說他倒楣只會為他求職的機會招來霉運，老實說。
We shouldn't talk about the perfect weather; that'll jinx our picnic plans for sure.
我們不該一直說天氣多完美，這樣肯定會為野餐計畫招來霉運。
(\"I'll give you that.\",): After seeing the numbers, I'll give you that this investment could actually work out well.
看了那些數字之後，我得承認這項投資其實可能會有好結果。
You handled the negotiation perfectly, I'll give you that, but the price still feels high.
你處理談判很完美，這點我得承認，但價格仍然感覺偏高。
(\"That's a given\",): With her experience and network, landing that client? That's a given, no question.
以她的經驗和人脈，拿下那個客戶？那是理所當然的，毫無疑問。
We booked the venue months ago, so the party happening? That's a given.
我們幾個月前就訂好場地了，所以派對會如期舉行？那是理所當然的。
(\"twist one's arm\",): You don't have to twist his arm; he'll volunteer once he hears the plan.
你不用逼他；他一聽到計畫就會自告奮勇。
If I twist his arm one more time, he'll probably explode with frustration.
如果我再逼他一次，他可能會氣得爆發。
('Learn the ropes',): Ask questions early so you can learn the ropes and avoid silly mistakes.
早點多問問題，這樣你才能熟悉狀況，避免犯愚蠢的錯誤。
I'll shadow Sarah for a month to learn the ropes before leading projects.
我會跟著Sarah觀摩一個月，先熟悉流程再帶領專案。
('Savage',): After hearing the critic's savage review, she decided to never trust reviews blindly.
看到評論家那篇尖刻無情的影評後，她決定不再盲目相信評論。
The storm left a savage trail through the town, damaging houses and blocking roads.
暴風在鎮上肆虐，造成房屋受損並阻斷道路。
(\"Don't put yourself out\",): Don't put yourself out helping me move; I already hired professional movers.
別勞駕幫我搬家；我已經請了專業搬運工。
Don't put yourself out worrying about the event; everything is already under control.
別為這個活動操心；一切已經在掌控之中。
('Sassy',): Don't be so sassy with your grandparents when they ask polite questions.
別在長輩問些客氣問題時對他們那麼無禮。
He gave a sassy wink and walked away from the awkward conversation.
他放肆地眨了眨眼，然後從那場尷尬的對話中走開了。
('I have a thing for you',): I have a thing for you, so meeting you always brightens my day.
我對你有好感，所以見到你總是讓我心情變好。
Even though we're friends, I have a thing for you and it's complicated.
即使我們是朋友，我對你有好感，事情有點複雜。
('Hand to god',): Hand to God, he told me the secret and begged me not to repeat it.
我向上帝發誓，他把祕密告訴我，還央求我別說出去。
Hand to God, if I forget, remind me before we walk out the door.
我向上帝發誓，如果我忘了，出門前提醒我。
('Make a scene',): If you make a scene now, we'll never hear the end of it again.
如果你現在大吵大鬧，我們之後就會被念個沒完沒了。
She threatened to make a scene unless they refunded her ticket immediately.
她威脅說要在那裡大吵大鬧，除非他們馬上把票退給她。
('take it in stride',): I'm surprised he could take it in stride after getting such bad news yesterday.
我很驚訝他昨天收到那麼糟的消息後還能泰然處之。
If you take it in stride, you'll learn faster and stress much less overall.
如果你能泰然處之，你會學得更快，整體壓力也會少得多。
(\"pull one's leg\",): I knew she was pulling my leg when she said she met a celebrity.
當她說她遇到名人時，我就知道她在逗我。
Stop trying to pull my leg; I heard that crazy rumor already yesterday.
別再逗我了；我昨天就已經聽過那個荒唐的謠言。
('Beats me',): When they asked who broke the vase, my honest answer was, 'Beats me'.
當他們問誰打破花瓶時，我老實回答說：「我不知道。」
Beats me how he's managed to finish the project before the tight deadline.
我不知道他怎麼能在緊迫的截止日期前完成這個專案。
('have someone going',): Don't be angry; he only had you going as a harmless April Fool's joke.
別生氣；他只是把你當作愚人節的無害玩笑騙騙而已。
Her stories always have us going until the surprising punchline finally arrives.
她的故事總是讓我們信以為真，直到驚人的結局出現為止。
(\"You're way off\",): Honestly, you're way off about how much that used car is actually worth.
說實話，你對那輛二手車的實際價值完全判斷錯誤。
If you base decisions on that rumor, you're way off and will regret it.
如果你根據那個謠言做決定，你完全錯了會後悔的。
